List of all members.

Public Member Functions

 Master (ConnectionManagerPtr &, PropertiesPtr &, ServerKeepaliveHandlerPtr &)
 Sets up the m_base_dir variable to be the absolute path of the root of the Hyperspace directory (with no trailing slash); Locks this root directory to prevent concurrent masters and then reads/increments/writes the 32-bit integer attribute 'generation'; Creates the server Keepalive handler.
 ~Master ()
void mkdir (ResponseCallback *cb, uint64_t session_id, const char *name)

Sets up the m_base_dir variable to be the absolute path of the root of the Hyperspace directory (with no trailing slash); Locks this root directory to prevent concurrent masters and then reads/increments/writes the 32-bit integer attribute 'generation'; Creates the server Keepalive handler.

Lock the base directory to prevent concurrent masters

Load and increment generation number

Definition at line 183 of file Master.cc.

int Master::renew_session_lease ( uint64_t  session_id  ) 

Attempts to renew the session lease for session with the given ID.

If the session cannot be found or if it is expired, the method returns Error::HYPERSPACE_EXPIRED_SESSION otherwise, it renews the session lease by invoking the RenewLease method of the SessionData object.

Parameters:
session_id Session ID to renew
Returns:
Error::OK if successful

Definition at line 1074 of file Master.cc.

bool Master::find_parent_node ( const std::string &  normal_name,
NodeDataPtr &  parent_node,
std::string &  child_name 
) [private]

Locates the parent 'node' of the given pathname.

It determines the name of the parent node by stripping off the characters incuding and after the last '/' character. It then looks up the name in the m_node_map and sets the pointer reference 'parent_node' to it. As a side effect, it also saves the child name (e.g. characters after the last '/' character to the string reference child_name. NOTE: This method locks the m_node_map_mutex.

Parameters:
normal_name Normalized (e.g. no trailing '/') name of path to find parent of
parent_node pointer reference to hold return pointer
child_name reference to string to hold the child directory entry name
Returns:
true if parent node found, false otherwise
